tp:docstring.p: The Media Player Remote Interfacing Specification is a standard D-Bus interface which aims to provide a common programmatic API for controlling media players.
Each media player must request an unique bus name which begins with org.mpris.mediaplayers. For example:

In the case where the media player allows multiple instances running simultaneously, each additional instance should request a unique bus name, adding a dot and a unique identifier (such as a UNIX process id) to its usual bus name. For example, this could be

The MPRIS defines a PropertiesChanged signal on each interface. It works the same way as org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties.PropertiesChanged. and it allows implementation to use bindings which do not support the new org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties.PropertiesChanged signal. Media players must emit both signals whenever properties annotated with org.freedesktop.DBus.Property.EmitsChangedSignal change.
